skill.name: Code Quality Skill
skill.description: Code quality validation, formatting, linting, and pre-commit checks.
skill.summary: Code quality validation, formatting, linting, and pre-commit checks.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidelines for code quality tools. No executable code, network access, or filesystem modifications.

content.value_statement: Code quality issues slow down teams and introduce bugs. This skill provides automated checks for formatting, linting, and type safety using industry-standard Python tools.
actual_capabilities: Format Python code with Black and Ruff
Run linting checks with Ruff using PyStrict rules
Perform type checking with BasedPyright strict mode
Validate naming conventions across the codebase
limitations: Only supports Python projects using UV as package manager
Does not modify code automatically beyond basic fixes
Cannot configure linting rules from within the skill
Requires pre-commit to be installed separately

output: Format issues found: 12 files need formatting

best_practices: Run quality checks before every commit to catch issues early
Use the strict mode for type checking to catch more potential bugs
Configure pre-commit hooks to enforce quality gates automatically
anti_patterns: Skipping quality checks to save time leads to technical debt accumulation
Ignoring type errors in strict mode defeats the purpose of type checking
Using per-file ignores without documentation creates inconsistent code

faq.question: Which Python tools are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports Black, Ruff, BasedPyright, and pre-commit. Projects must use UV as the package manager.

faq.question: What is the line length standard?
faq.answer: The default line length is 88 characters, which matches Black's default configuration.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Run the same commands in your CI pipeline: uv run ruff check . and uv run basedpyright src/

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads your code locally to perform analysis. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why am I seeing type errors with strict mode?
faq.answer: BasedPyright strict mode catches potential bugs by requiring complete type annotations. Fix the errors or add explicit type ignores.

faq.question: How does this compare to other linters?
faq.answer: Ruff is 10-100x faster than traditional linters. BasedPyright is stricter than MyPy, catching more potential issues at the cost of more upfront work.
